publications.name: Non-monotonic effect of Stokes number on turbulence modulation in particle-laden channel flow
publications.summary: Four-way coupled PP-DNS shows that increasing particle inertia first enhances, then reduces drag, before returning to the single-phase state. Turbulence modulation is driven by the competition between particle-induced transport and dissipation, as revealed by a comprehensive two-phase statistical analysis. Analytical examination of limiting Stokes numbers (0 or âˆž) clarifies particle inertia effects.

publications.name: GPU acceleration of four-way coupled PP-DNS for compressible particle-laden wall turbulence
publications.summary: A multi-GPU acceleration strategy is proposed to enable efficient four-way coupled PP-DNS of particle-laden turbulence, demonstrating the feasibility and significance of capturing four-way coupling effects with large particle numbers.

publications.name: Reduced-order variational mode decomposition to reveal transient and non-stationary dynamics in fluid flows
publications.summary: A novel modal analysis method named RVMD is proposed, and its combination with Hilbert spectral analysis yields a modal-based time-frequency analysis framework in the Hilbert view, providing a powerful tool to discover, quantify, and analyse low-order dynamics with transient and nonstationary properties in spatiotemporal data.
